did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Papers of the People's Committee Against Gambling, 1950
did.abstract: The People's Committee Against Gambling was a group formed to defeat Initiative Measure 302-303, aimed at legalizing gambling in Arizona. David Brinegar was its director. Collection includes a journal of activities, news releases, financial statements, and related papers; chiefly typescript material, with holograph notations, pertaining to a statewide campaign to defeat proposed legislation aimed at legalizing gambling in Arizona. Also included is a 1981 interview with David Brinegar about the campaign.

repository.label: Repository

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired as gift of David Brinegar, 1963.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Group formed to defeat Initiative Measure 302-303, aimed at legalizing gambling in Arizona. David Brinegar was its director.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has a chronological arrangement and is organized into 2 series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Journal of activities, news releases, financial statements,and related papers; chiefly typescript material, with holograph notations, pertaining to a statewide campaign to defeat proposed legislation aimed at legalizing gambling in Arizona. Also included is a 1981 interview with David Brinegar about the campaign.
